page.title: 07Farming - Pigs
page.content: A local farmer farms 700 acres.The {soil}varies from medium loam to .He employs eight full_time{workers}and has considerable{machinery}to the variety of{crops}grown, e.g.{winter barley,sugur_beet and spring barley and contracts to grow peas for a national freezer company.In 1973 he changed from dairy farming to breeding pigs.On average,{200 sows}can produce 2 to 3 litters of 9 to 10 piglets per annum.He purchases rations for the sows and uses a home produced ration for the piglets.The majority of pigs are for the supermarket trade and are sent to local abattoirs at 17 weeks,weighing 55Kg.Bacon pigs are kept a little longer.Shortage of space means selling pigs,regardless of market price.Aujezkys disease is a major problem with pigs at present.
